title: Define Project Scope and Requirements - REVISED
description: Revised and expanded detailed requirements for the LiveDocumentationUpdater system. The requirements include types of documentation to be updated (e.g., user guides, API docs, code comments, technical blogs), sources of code and process changes (including version control systems such as GitHub or Bitbucket, continuous integration/continuous deployment pipelines like Jenkins or CircleCI, event-driven triggers such as webhooks or events from messaging queues), desired update mechanisms (real-time, scheduled, on-demand), handling of edge cases such as merges, pull requests, hotfixes, support for multiple programming languages, and consideration for compatibility with various IDEs. This aim is to provide a comprehensive understanding of the system's intended functionality, its interactions with other components, and how it will adapt to our ever-evolving development landscape. Additionally, it would be beneficial to consider integrating the system with popular issue tracking tools like Jira or GitHub Issues for better traceability.

title: Design System Architecture
description: Design the overall architecture of the LiveDocumentationUpdater system, including the components, their interactions, and the data flow.

title: Develop Code Change Monitoring
description: Implement the mechanisms for monitoring code changes in the source control system and triggering the documentation update process.

title: Develop Process Change Monitoring
description: Implement the mechanisms for monitoring process changes (e.g., workflow updates, policy changes) and triggering the documentation update process.

title: Develop Documentation Update Engine
description: Implement the core engine that updates the documentation based on the detected code and process changes.

title: Integrate with Documentation Sources
description: Develop the mechanisms for integrating with various documentation sources (e.g., wikis, knowledge bases, code comments) and updating them with the changes.

title: Develop User Interface
description: Design and implement a user interface for configuring the system, monitoring the update process, and accessing the updated documentation.

title: Set up Testing and Deployment
description: Define and implement the testing strategies and deployment processes for the LiveDocumentationUpdater system.

title: Conduct Security Review
description: Perform a comprehensive security review of the LiveDocumentationUpdater system to identify and mitigate potential vulnerabilities.

title: Write User Documentation
description: Create comprehensive user documentation for the LiveDocumentationUpdater system, including installation guides, configuration instructions, and usage examples.
